Dictionary.Name: The Collaborative International Dictionary of English v.0.44

Definition.WordDefinition:
Androgynous \An*drog"y*nous\, Androgynal \An*drog"y*nal\, a. [L. androgynus, Gr. ?; 'anh`r, 'andro`s, man + gynh` woman: cf. F. androgyne.] 1. Uniting both sexes in one, or having the characteristics of both; being in nature both male and female; hermaphroditic. --Owen. [1913 Webster]
The truth is, a great mind must be androgynous. --Coleridge. [1913 Webster]
2. (Bot.) Bearing both staminiferous and pistilliferous flowers in the same cluster. [1913 Webster]
androgynous adj : having both male and female characteristics [ant: {male}, {female}]
